parts.title: READING PASSAGE 1
parts.content:
READING PASSAGE 1

You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions 1 - 13 which are based on Reading Passage 1 below.

The Industrial Revolution in Britain

The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the mid-1700s and by the 1830s and 1840s had spread to many other parts of the world, including the United States. In Britain, it was a period when a largely rural, agrarian* society was transformed into an industrialised, urban one. Goods that had once been crafted by hand started to be produced in mass quantities by machines in factories, thanks to the invention of steam power and the introduction of new machines and manufacturing techniques in textiles, iron-making and other industries.

The foundations of the Industrial Revolution date back to the early 1700s, when the English inventor Thomas Newcomen designed the first modern steam engine. Called the 'atmospheric steam engine', Newcomen's invention was originally used to power machines that pumped water out of mines. In the 1760s, the Scottish engineer James Watt started to adapt one of Newcomen's models, and succeeded in making it far more efficient. Watt later worked with the English manufacturer Matthew Boulton to invent {[a new steam engine driven by both the forward and backward strokes of the piston, while the gear mechanism it was connected to produced rotary motion.][1]}It was a key innovation that would allow steam power to spread across British industries.

{[The demand for coal, which was a relatively cheap energy source, grew rapidly during the Industrial Revolution, as it was needed to run not only the factories used to produce manufactured goods, but also steam-powered transportation.][2]}In the early 1800s, the English engineer Richard Trevithick built a steam-powered locomotive, and by 1830 goods and passengers were being transported between the industrial centres of Manchester and Liverpool. {[In addition, steam-powered boats and ships were widely used to carry goods along Britain's canals as well as across the Atlantic.][8]}

Britain had produced textiles like wool, linen and cotton, for hundreds of years, but prior to the Industrial Revolution, the British textile business was a true 'cottage industry', with {[the work performed in small workshops or even homes by individual spinners, weavers and dyers.][3]}Starting in the mid-1700s, innovations like the spinning jenny and the power loom made weaving cloth and spinning yarn and thread much easier. {[With these machines, relatively little labour was required to produce cloth,][4]}and the new, mechanised textile factories that opened around the country were quickly able to meet customer demand for cloth both at home and abroad. 

The British iron industry also underwent major change as it adopted new innovations. Chief among the new techniques was the smelting of iron ore with coke (a material made by heating coal) instead of the traditional charcoal. {[This method was cheaper and produced metals that were of a higher quality,][5-9]}{[enabling Britain's iron and steel production to expand in response to demand created by the Napoleonic Wars (1803-15) and the expansion of the railways from the 1830s.][6-9]}

The latter part of the Industrial Revolution also saw key advances in communication methods, as people increasingly saw the need to communicate efficiently over long distances. {[In 1837, British inventors William Cooke and Charles Wheatstone patented the first commercial telegraphy system. In the 1830s and 1840s, Samuel Morse and other inventors worked on their own versions in the United States.][10]}Cooke and Wheatstone's system was soon used for railway signalling in the UK. As the speed of the new locomotives increased, it was essential to have a fast and effective means of avoiding collisions.

The impact of the Industrial Revolution on people's lives was immense. Although many people in Britain had begun moving to the cities from rural areas before the Industrial Revolution, this accelerated dramatically with industrialisation, as the rise of large factories turned smaller towns into major cities in just a few decades. This rapid urbanisation brought significant challenges, as {[overcrowded cities suffered from pollution and inadequate sanitation.][7]}

{[Although industrialisation increased the country's economic output overall and improved the standard of living for the middle and upper classes, many poor people continued to struggle.][11]}Factory workers had to work long hours in dangerous conditions for extremely low wages. These conditions along with the rapid pace of change fuelled opposition to industrialisation. A group of British workers who became known as 'Luddites' were British weavers and textile workers who objected to the increased use of mechanised looms and knitting frames. {[Many had spent years learning their craft, and they feared that unskilled machine operators were robbing them of their livelihood.][12]}A few desperate weavers began breaking into factories and smashing textile machines. They called themselves Luddites after Ned Ludd, a young apprentice who was rumoured to have wrecked a textile machine in 1779.

The first major instances of machine breaking took place in 1811 in the city of Nottingham, and the practice soon spread across the country. Machine-breaking Luddites attacked and burned factories, and in some cases they even exchanged gunfire with company guards and soldiers. The workers wanted employers to stop installing new machinery, but the British government responded to the uprisings by making machine-breaking punishable by death. {[The unrest finally reached its peak in April 1812, when a few Luddites were shot during an attack on a mill near Huddersfield. In the days that followed, other Luddites were arrested, and dozens were hanged or transported to Australia.][13]}By 1813, the Luddite resistance had all but vanished. 

* agrarian: relating to the land, especially the use of land for farming.

instruction.title: Reading passage 1
instruction.content: You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions {start_question} - {end_question} which are based on Reading Passage 1 below.

question_sets.title: Questions 1-7
question_sets.description: Complete the summary below.\nChoose NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the passage for each answer.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet.
question_sets.content:
Britain's Industrial Revolution

Steam power

• Newcomen's steam engine was used in mines to remove water.

• In Watt and Boulton's steam engine, the movement of the ______ was linked to a gear system.

• A greater supply of ______ was required to power steam engines.

Textile industry

• Before the Industrial Revolution, spinners and weavers worked at home and in ______

• Not as much ______ was needed to produce cloth once the spinning jenny and power loom were invented.

Iron industry

• Smelting of iron ore with coke resulted in material that was better ______

• Demand for iron increased with the growth of the ______

Communications

• Cooke and Wheatstone patented the first telegraphy system.

• The telegraphy system was used to prevent locomotives colliding.

Urbanisation

• Small towns turned into cities very quickly.

• The new cities were dirty, crowded and lacked sufficient ______

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm từ chỉ bộ phận của máy hơi nước được nối với hệ thống bánh răng.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm loại nhiên liệu cần thiết để vận hành máy hơi nước.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm nơi làm việc của thợ dệt trước Cách mạng Công nghiệp.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm từ chỉ sự giảm thiểu trong sản xuất vải sau khi có máy dệt.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm đặc tính được cải thiện của sắt khi nấu chảy với than cốc.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm ngành giao thông làm tăng nhu cầu sắt.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cần tìm dịch vụ thiếu hụt trong các thành phố mới.

question_sets.title: Questions 8-13
question_sets.description:
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 1?
In boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet, write:
TRUE if the statement agrees with the information
FALSE if the statement contradicts the information
NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Mạng lưới kênh đào của Anh phát triển nhanh chóng để có thể vận chuyển nhiều hàng hóa hơn khắp đất nước.
questions.text: Britain's canal network grew rapidly so that more goods could be transported around the country.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Chi phí trong ngành công nghiệp sắt tăng lên khi kỹ thuật nấu chảy quặng sắt bằng than cốc được giới thiệu.
questions.text: Costs in the iron industry rose when the technique of smelting iron ore with coke was introduced.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Hệ thống thông tin liên lạc của Samuel Morse đáng tin cậy hơn hệ thống được phát triển bởi William Cooke và Charles Wheatstone.
questions.text: Samuel Morse's communication system was more reliable than that developed by William Cooke and Charles Wheatstone.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Lợi ích kinh tế của công nghiệp hóa bị giới hạn trong một số lĩnh vực nhất định của xã hội.
questions.text: The economic benefits of industrialisation were limited to certain sectors of society.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Một số thợ dệt có tay nghề tin rằng việc giới thiệu máy dệt mới sẽ dẫn đến mất việc làm.
questions.text: Some skilled weavers believed that the introduction of the new textile machines would lead to job losses.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Có một số sự thông cảm của người dân địa phương đối với những kẻ Luddite bị bắt gần Huddersfield.
questions.text: There was some sympathy among local people for the Luddites who were arrested near Huddersfield.

parts.transcription: [{"to": 68.314995, "from": 66.954994, "text": "Two of our classes.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 71.115, "from": 68.555, "text": "Okay. What would you like to know?", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 78.395, "from": 71.674995, "text": "Well, I'm new to this area. So perhaps you could tell me something about the park first, please.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 101.045, "from": 78.79, "text": "Of course. Altogether, the park covers a 70 acres. That's 69 hectares. There are three main types of habitat, wetland, grassland and woodland. The woods are well established and varied, with an oak plantation and other areas of mixed species.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 125.265, "from": 101.045, "text": "Right. The wetland is quite varied too. The original farmland was dug up around forty years ago to extract gravel. Once this work was completed, the gravel pits filled with water, forming the two large lakes. There are also several smaller ones, ponds, and a stream that flows through the park.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 132.945, "from": 125.265, "text": "Okay. So I suppose with these different habitats, there's quite a variety of wildlife.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 142.23001, "from": 132.945, "text": "There certainly is. A lot of different species of birds and insects, and also animals like deer and rabbits.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 147.03, "from": 142.47, "text": "And I understand you organise educational visits for school parties.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 154.735, "from": 147.375, "text": "That's right. We can organise a wide range of activities and adapt them to suit all ages.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 158.175, "from": 154.895, "text": "Can you give me some examples of the activities?", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 172.2, "from": 158.655, "text": "Well, one focus is on science, where we help children to discover and study plants, trees and insects. They also collect and analyse data about the things they see.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 173.0, "from": 172.2, "text": "Uh-huh.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 184.705, "from": 173.0, "text": "Another focus is on geography. The park is a great environment to learn and practice reading a map and using a compass to navigate around the park.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 188.305, "from": 185.265, "text": "Do you do anything connected with history?", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 199.23001, "from": 188.83, "text": "Yes. We do. For instance, the children can explore how the use of the land has changed over time. Then there's leisure and tourism.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 203.06999, "from": 199.63, "text": "That focuses on your visitors, I would imagine.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 224.84999, "from": 203.445, "text": "Yes. Mostly. The children find out about them, their requirements, the problems they may cause, and how we manage these. And another subject we cover is music. Here, the children experiment with natural materials to create sounds and explore rhythm and tempo.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 226.29, "from": 224.84999, "text": "That must be fun.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 228.60999, "from": 226.37, "text": "Most children really enjoy it.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 278.21002, "from": 265.045, "text": "And, of course, all the activities are educational too. Learning outside the classroom encourages children to be creative and to explore and discover for themselves.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 284.77002, "from": 278.37, "text": "I would imagine they get a sense of freedom that might not be a normal part of their lives.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 297.425, "from": 284.77002, "text": "That's right. And very often, the children discover that they can do things they didn't know they could do, and they develop new skills. This gives them greater self confidence.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 311.6, "from": 297.585, "text": "It sounds great. So what about the practical side of it? How much does it cost for a full day visit? We would expect to bring between thirty and forty children.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 333.83, "from": 312.17502, "text": "If there are over 30, it costs £4.95 for each child who attends on the day. We invoice you afterwards, so you don't pay for children who can't come because of sickness, for example. There's no charge for leaders and other adults, as many as you want to bring.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 345.615, "from": 333.91, "text": "That sounds very fair. Well, thanks for all the information. I'll need to discuss it with my colleagues, and I hope to get back to you soon to make a booking.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}, {"to": 348.815, "from": 345.615, "text": "We'll look forward to hearing from you. Goodbye.", "speaker": "Speaker 2"}, {"to": 351.295, "from": 348.975, "text": "Goodbye, and thank you.", "speaker": "Speaker 1"}]

parts.title: READING PASSAGE 2
parts.content:
Reading Passage 2

Content will be migrated from V1 part content...

instruction.title: Reading passage 2
instruction.content: You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions {start_question} - {end_question} which are based on Reading Passage 2 below.

question_sets.title: Questions 14-18
question_sets.description:
Reading Passage 2 has six paragraphs, A-F.
Which paragraph contains the following information?
Write the correct letter, A-F, in boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet.
NB You may use any letter more than once.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Tìm đoạn văn đề cập đến hai hợp chất hóa học có tác động đến hiệu suất.
questions.text: reference to two chemical compounds which impact on performance

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Ví dụ về các chiến lược để giảm thiểu tác động của căng thẳng.
questions.text: examples of strategies for minimising the effects of stress

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cách một vận động viên giải thích cho trải nghiệm căng thẳng của chính họ.
questions.text: how a sportsperson accounted for their own experience of stress

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Kết quả nghiên cứu chỉ ra mối liên hệ giữa phản ứng căng thẳng và hiệu suất.
questions.text: study results indicating links between stress responses and performance

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Đề cập đến những người có thể ảnh hưởng đến cách vận động viên nhận thức phản ứng căng thẳng của họ.
questions.text: mention of people who can influence how athletes perceive their stress responses

question_sets.title: Questions 19-22
question_sets.description: Complete the summary below.\nChoose NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the passage for each answer.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet.
question_sets.content:
• Performance stress involves many demands on the athlete, for example, coping with the possible risk of ______
  • Cortisol can cause tennis players to produce fewer good ______
  • Psychologists can help athletes to view their physiological responses as the effect of a positive feeling such as ______
  • ______ is an example of a psychological technique which can reduce an athlete's stress responses.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Căng thẳng thành tích bao gồm nhiều yêu cầu đối với vận động viên, ví dụ như đối phó với nguy cơ có thể xảy ra.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cortisol có thể khiến các tay vợt tennis tạo ra ít cú giao bóng tốt hơn.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Các nhà tâm lý học có thể giúp vận động viên xem phản ứng sinh lý của họ như tác động của một cảm giác tích cực.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Đây là một ví dụ về kỹ thuật tâm lý có thể giảm phản ứng căng thẳng của vận động viên.

question_sets.title: Questions 23-24
question_sets.description: Choose TWO letters, A-E.\nWhich TWO statements about Emma Raducanu's withdrawal from Wimbledon are mentioned in the passage?

options.text: the stage at which she dropped out of the tournament
symptoms of her performance stress at the tournament
measures which she had taken to manage her stress levels
aspects of the Wimbledon tournament which increased her stress levels
reactions to her social media posts about her experience at Wimbledon

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu yêu cầu câu hỏi:
Tìm ra HAI nhận định về việc Emma Raducanu rút lui khỏi giải Wimbledon được đề cập trong bài.
Bước 2: Đáp án B - triệu chứng căng thẳng khi thi đấu của cô ấy.

Bước 1: Hiểu yêu cầu câu hỏi:
Tìm ra HAI nhận định về việc Emma Raducanu rút lui khỏi giải Wimbledon được đề cập trong bài.
Bước 2: Đáp án D - các khía cạnh của giải Wimbledon làm tăng mức độ căng thẳng của cô.

question_sets.title: Questions 25-26
question_sets.description: Choose TWO letters, A-E.\nWhich TWO statements about anxiety are mentioned in paragraph E?

options.text: the factors which determine how severe it may be
how long it takes for its effects to become apparent
which of its symptoms is most frequently encountered
the types of athletes who are most likely to suffer from it
the harm that can result if athletes experience it too often

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu yêu cầu câu hỏi:
Tìm ra HAI nhận định về chứng lo âu được đề cập trong đoạn E của bài đọc.
Bước 2: Đáp án A - các yếu tố quyết định mức độ nghiêm trọng của lo lắng.

Bước 1: Hiểu yêu cầu câu hỏi:
Tìm ra HAI nhận định về chứng lo âu được đề cập trong đoạn E của bài đọc.
Bước 2: Đáp án E - tác hại có thể xảy ra nếu vận động viên trải qua nó quá thường xuyên.

parts.title: READING PASSAGE 3
parts.content:
Reading Passage 3

Content will be migrated from V1 part content...

instruction.title: Reading passage 3
instruction.content: You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions {start_question} - {end_question} which are based on Reading Passage 3 below.

question_sets.title: Questions 27-32
question_sets.description: Complete the notes below.\nChoose NO MORE THAN ONE WORD from the passage for each answer.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet.
question_sets.content:
Notes on Maryam Mirzakhani

Background:
  • Maryam Mirzakhani is regarded as ______ in the field of mathematics because she was the only female holder of the prestigious Fields Medal
  • As a child, maths held little ______ for her and her performance was below average
  • She became ______ by a difficult puzzle that one of her siblings showed her
Professional Career:
  • She proved herself to be ______ when things did not go smoothly
  • She got the greatest ______ from making ground-breaking discoveries
  • She was responsible for some extremely ______ mathematical studies

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Maryam Mirzakhani được coi là duy nhất trong lĩnh vực toán học.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Toán học ít có sức hấp dẫn đối với cô khi còn nhỏ.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cô trở nên quan tâm bởi một câu đố khó mà anh chị em của cô đưa ra.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cô tỏ ra quyết tâm khi mọi việc không diễn ra suôn sẻ.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cô có được sự hài lòng lớn nhất từ việc tạo ra những khám phá đột phá.

Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Cô chịu trách nhiệm cho một số nghiên cứu toán học cực kỳ sáng tạo.

question_sets.title: Questions 33-37
question_sets.description:
Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage 3?
In boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet, write:
YES if the statement agrees with the views of the writer
NO if the statement contradicts the views of the writer
NOT GIVEN if it is impossible to say what the writer thinks about this

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Nhiều người cuối cùng đoạt được những giải thưởng trí tuệ uy tín chỉ đạt được mức trung bình khi còn trẻ.
questions.text: Many people who ended up winning prestigious intellectual prizes only reached an average standard when young.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Những thất bại của Einstein khi còn trẻ là do thiếu tự tin.
questions.text: Einstein's failures as a young man were due to his lack of confidence.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Thật khó để đạt được sự thống nhất về việc liệu một số trẻ em có thực sự được sinh ra với năng khiếu hay không.
questions.text: It is difficult to reach agreement on whether some children are actually born gifted.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Einstein bị tổn thương bởi quan điểm của công chúng về công việc của cuộc đời ông.
questions.text: Einstein was upset by the public's view of his life's work.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Einstein cho rằng thành công của ông là do tốc độ giải quyết các vấn đề khoa học.
questions.text: Einstein put his success down to the speed at which he dealt with scientific questions.

question_sets.title: Questions 38-40
question_sets.description: Choose the correct letter, A, B, C or D.\nWrite the correct letters in boxes {start_question}-{end_question} on your answer sheet.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Tác giả đề xuất điều gì quan trọng nhất để phát triển khả năng xuất sắc ở những người trẻ tuổi?
questions.text: What does the writer suggest is most important for developing outstanding ability in young people?

options.text: strict discipline from the teaching staff
assistance from their peers in the classroom
the development of a spirit of inquiry towards their studies
the determination to surpass everyone else's achievements

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Theo văn bản, điều gì đúng về những cá nhân có năng khiếu nhất?
questions.text: According to the text, what is true of the most gifted individuals?

options.text: Very gifted students do not need to work on improving memory skills.
Being born with a special gift is not the key factor in becoming expert.
Including time for physical exercise is crucial in raising performance.
10,000 hours of relevant and demanding work will create a genius.

questions.explain:
Bước 1: Hiểu câu hỏi:
Tác giả đề xuất yếu tố nào quan trọng nhất trong việc quyết định thành công trong tương lai của một đứa trẻ?
questions.text: Which factor does the writer suggest is most important in determining a child's future success?

options.text: a regular and nourishing diet at home.
the loving support of more than one parent.
a community which has well-funded facilities for learning.
the guidance of someone who recognises the benefits of learning.
